column4: I'm having some trouble with dvd playback in ubuntu 8.10.  It says there is no media on disk. I can play dvd's ive burned.  Anyone know how to fix this?
yeah, did you install libdvdcss2?
yea i d
and css3 and a few other
so just to make sure, if you type "sudo apt-get install libdvdcss2" in a terminal, it says ......?
0 upgraded, 0 installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded
when i installed libdvd it let me play a dvd i burned from a .iso
it just wont let me play normal dvd films
ok, now how about "sudo apt-get install vlc" ?
vlc player always works the best
i have vlc
ive been using it for years
ok, did you try using vlc for opening the dvd?
yea, i have it set as the default program
so if a disc is in, and you go to vlc and open the disc, what does it say?
it doesnt say anything, vlc opens and it just stays gray, no video
but vlc works on other files?
when i try "movie player" or "th"thoggen" or "brasero" it says "no media on disk
vlc sees it
just when it tries to play it wont play
vlc works great for everything else
any chance it's a defective dvd?
